Html:
Hey all. Couple things.

  • I have a massive inbox of requests for the Rawr3 beta. If I haven't responded to yours, please be patient, I'm going through them as fast as I can.
  • Just posted a new build of Rawr3, which includes a new Chart Picker control. It's a new bit of UI to help you swap between charts quickly and easily, and to show off the fact that there are a variety of different charts to new users (so many people just would leave it on Gear charts with the Rawr2 chart dropdowns, and just change the slot, never realizing that there were enchant charts, buff charts, talent charts, model specific charts, gem charts, etc). I'm hoping that this interface will be much more usable. Please check it out if you're in the Rawr3 beta, and post your feedback here.

 

There are two known issues:

  1. There's no 'stickiness' to the menu yet. It's very subtle, but notice in using normal menu controls (you know, like any standard program menu), an item with subitems doesn't pop open until you're moused over it for a brief period of time; it's not instant. It can vary by OS, but it's usually in the 0.1 to 0.3sec range. That's enough time so that you can mouse over one item, then go to move your cursor to the submenu items, but graze the corner of another parent item, and it won't swap you to the other submenu. Most people probably don't even notice it, but it's there, and it makes menus much easier to use, and forgiving of slightly off cursor movements. Rawr3's ChartPicker doesn't have this yet. I'm going to build it in, but in the mean time, expect to get annoyed with it as you try to move to one of the sub menu items, and accidentally switch the submenu.
  2. It includes several new charts, which are not yet implemented. I've implemented all of the charts from Rawr2 that weren't implemented yet in Rawr3, but there's still 5 more new ones which aren't implemented yet.

 

That's it, look forward to feedback on this.
I'm loving this new chart-picker, makes it REALLY obvious that there's more than just the Gear chart to look at. That stickiness you mention isn't really that big of a problem from what I can tell.

Cat Model

Options Tab

Fight Parameters - a newbie isn't going to have much idea about what Boss Armour value to input. Could also help more experienced people if there was a drop down menu or something indicating example levels for average boss in TOC10/25 or ICC10/25 heroic/normal.

Misc - Sentence under Trinket Offset is cutoff - it reads "This indicates that you unequip and then reequip one of".

 

Install Offline - button not working?

 

The new menu/mouseover system is a gigantic step forward in ease-of-use for me. Right on.

 

Gemming Templates stuff is still confusing the new user and I still can't seem to figure out if I need to mess with it to be able to have Rawr tell me if/when it's a significant increase in dps if I switch from Agi to ArPen gemming.

 

BossHandler (first time I've even seen it, being on a Mac and somewhat mono-challenged) is obviously a powerful tool if you know exactly which fight you need to optimize yourself for. However - still confusing for the average new user unless you use a drop down menu of common pre-configured typical encounters/bosses and what you could reasonably expect on them - or similar. I suppose a mouseover system could work, or just leave as is and have it for advanced users only. Or expand the Help documentation. This module also seems be a significant step up in workload on your programmers/developers, but not having any coding experience I wouldn't know. Awesome feature idea though.

 

Everything in the Options drop down menu could use mouseover tooltips imo.

 

Would dearly love mouse-wheel scrolling in the right-hand window pane.

 

Gear > Wrists didn't seem to work, everything else so far is fine. Click on Gear, mouse over Wrists and click on - gear display list doesn't change from whatever was there before.

 

Tabbed away to write this and had to reload character after I tabbed back. Happened twice now.

 

ChartPicker - I'm guessing this is the name for the drop-down menu in the top left of the right-hand part of the Rawr interface. Looks great!

 

Cheers for all the hard work.

Well, wanted to keep this specific to the Chart Picker, but what the hell...

Boss Armor: It doesn't change for anything except target level. All 83 bosses have the same armor, 10683 (or whatever the default is). It's just there for people theorycrafting stuff out.

Install Offline: Looks like I broke that. Joy.

Gemming Templates are an advanced feature that 95% of users shouldn't touch; the defaults should satisfy all the typically viable gemming schemes. To that end, I'll be adding arpen templates to Cat defaults in the future.

BossHandler: You haven't seen this before because it's new, is totally not done, and isn't implemented at all in most models.

Tooltips on Options: Definitely, just hasn't been high priority.

Mouse Wheel support: Errr... This does work on PC... Could be that Silverlight's mousewheel support on Mac is broken... Will investigate.

Gear>Wrists: Oops, fixed.

Why did you have to reload your character?

 

Thanks!

Astry's Correct, I have not fully fleshed out the Boss Handler tab as it's a TON of work. If you want to know what this stuff does, go to DPSWarr in Rawr2 to see how the options play around. That's where this stuff is coming from, I'm just making it generic to Characters so that any model can use the same options instead of having to remake it per model.
